info.title: Crosswork Inventory API
info.description: This document contains details of the Crosswork Inventory RESTful APIs that can be used to onboard and manage Device Groups (Tags), Credentials, Providers and Devices

delete.summary: Delete the list of Credential Profiles

200.description: OK. The request was successful. The result is contained in the response body.

404.description: Not Found. The client made a request for a resource that does not exist.

200.description: OK. The request was successful. The result is contained in the response body.

404.description: Not Found. The client made a request for a resource that does not exist.

patch.summary: Updates or overwrites Credential Profiles in bulk

200.description: OK. The request was successful. The result is contained in the response body.

404.description: Not Found. The client made a request for a resource that does not exist.

post.summary: Retrieves credentials. A filter structure (RobotNodeData) can be supplied as a field in the structure RobotNodeGetReq, which is used to call this function.

200.description: OK. The request was successful. The result is contained in the response body.

404.description: Not Found. The client made a request for a resource that does not exist.

delete.summary: Delete operation via CSV file upload. With this API, the uploaded list of inventory will be deleted. Can be applied to Credentials, Tags, Providers and Devices

200.description: OK. The request was successful. The result is contained in the response body.

404.description: Not Found. The client made a request for a resource that does not exist.

post.summary: Add operation via CSV file upload. With this API, the uploaded list of inventory will be added to Crosswork. Can be applied to Credentials, Tags, Providers and Devices

200.description: OK. The request was successful. The result is contained in the response body.

404.description: Not Found. The client made a request for a resource that does not exist.

put.summary: Update operation via CSV file upload. With this API, the uploaded inventory list will be updated in Crossworks. Can be applied to Devices

200.description: OK. The request was successful. The result is contained in the response body.

404.description: Not Found. The client made a request for a resource that does not exist.

200.description: OK. The request was successful. The result is contained in the response body.

404.description: Not Found. The client made a request for a resource that does not exist.

200.description: OK. The request was successful. The result is contained in the response body.

404.description: Not Found. The client made a request for a resource that does not exist.

500.description: Internal Server Error. The server could not fulfill the request.

post.summary: Adds Node information to Crosswork. The client provides Node information as a list of RobotNodeData.

200.description: OK. The request was successful. The result is contained in the response body.

404.description: Not Found. The client made a request for a resource that does not exist.

patch.summary: Updates or overwrites Crosswork Nodes in bulk

200.description: OK. The request was successful. The result is contained in the response body.

404.description: Not Found. The client made a request for a resource that does not exist.

post.summary: This API retrieves a list of Nodes. It returns complete inventory data for each Node in the list. The user can apply various filters to retrieve specific sets of Nodes by specifying one or more fields to match. The user can also filter on combinations of supported fields.

200.description: OK. The request was successful. The result is contained in the response body.

404.description: Not Found. The client made a request for a resource that does not exist.

post.summary: Retrieves a list of Nodes. Currently, this API behaves just like the Get Nodes/Devices API.

200.description: OK. The request was successful. The result is contained in the response body.

404.description: Not Found. The client made a request for a resource that does not exist.

put.summary: Removes one or more Tag associations from the list of Nodes.

200.description: OK. The request was successful. The result is contained in the response body.

404.description: Not Found. The client made a request for a resource that does not exist.

get.summary: Retrieves a count of all Nodes in the database

200.description: OK. The request was successful. The result is contained in the response body.

404.description: Not Found. The client made a request for a resource that does not exist.

delete.summary: Delete Providers. A Provider can be deleted only if no Device is referencing the target Provider. Otherwise, the API returns an error.

200.description: OK. The request was successful. The result is contained in the response body.

404.description: Not Found. The client made a request for a resource that does not exist.

200.description: OK. The request was successful. The result is contained in the response body.

404.description: Not Found. The client made a request for a resource that does not exist.

200.description: OK. The request was successful. The result is contained in the response body.

404.description: Not Found. The client made a request for a resource that does not exist.

200.description: OK. The request was successful. The result is contained in the response body.

404.description: Not Found. The client made a request for a resource that does not exist.

delete.summary: Delete Crosswork Tags that are not yet associated with any Device or Node. A Tag cannot be deleted if it is associated with a Device or Node.

200.description: OK. The request was successful. The result is contained in the response body.

404.description: Not Found. The client made a request for a resource that does not exist.

post.summary: Create CrossWork Tags to be associated with Nodes or Devices

200.description: OK. The request was successful. The result is contained in the response body.

404.description: Not Found. The client made a request for a resource that does not exist.

200.description: OK. The request was successful. The result is contained in the response body.

404.description: Not Found. The client made a request for a resource that does not exist.

robotapiRobotCsvUploadReq.description: Request body for uploading a CSV file for any inventory type

robotapiRobotEntityConnectivityState.description: Derived reachability state for a Device. Cannot be set by user

robotapiRobotEntityLockState.description: A Device can be locked by an application to prevent other applications from using it. There are multiple possible lock states.

robotapiRobotGeoCoordinates.description: Geographical location data for a Node

robotapiRobotInvKeyType.description: Supported Inventory Key Types. The API uses the Inventory Key Typeâ€™s values to generate a unique UUID for the Device.

robotapiRobotNodeAdminState.description: Configured state for a Device. This is set during onboarding and can be updated as needed.

total_count.description: Number of total Credential Profiles available at present

uuid.description: Crosswork generates the UUID based on the key type and value provided by the user

mac.description: Chassis backplane MAC address. Can be used to generate UUID

serial_number.description: Device serial number. Can be used to generate UUID

host_name.description: Device host name. Can be used to generate UUID

profile.description: Required if the Device is configured to be UP on boarding: The Credential Profile applicable to this Device.

admin_state.title: Device state the administrator intends for the Device to go to.

connectivity_info.description: Required if the Device is configured to be UP: The list of Device connections

geo_info.description: Geographical location info for the Node

routing_info.description: Routing info and Management IP info

last_upd_time.description: Last time this Device entry was updated

provider.description: List of Providers. Only one per Provider type.

operational_state.description: Device operational state. Crosswork computes this, so the value is read-only.

errors.description: List of errors causing the Device to be in the ERROR state. Crosswork computes this, so the list is read-only.

number_of_nodes.description: The number of Devices onboarded to Crosswork

total_count.title: Total number of Nodes available at present

range_incr.description: Geographical range data increments. Applicable only on the request. Used only for transitional data to specify the increments (+/-) on the coordinates given above for finding the list of Devices within the range.

limit.description: Number of Nodes requested in the response. The Max Limit and Default Limit are both 100.

sort_by.description:
Sort_by would be used only for fetching the RobotNodeData.
     RobotNodeCredentials have only one Key "profile", which
     will be always used for sorting.

next_from.description: Deprecated - Response would contain Data with keys > next_from

creation_time.description: Job creation time in epoch seconds

impacted_count.description: Impacted Nodes, Tags, Providers or Credential Profiles

robotapiRobotNodeJob.description: Every Action related to Inventory will have a Job

job_id.description:
job_id or State would be supported filter
creation_time would be used for offset and sorting

limit.description: Page size. Max limit 100 per req

jobs.description: creation time based sorted list of RobotNodeJob

total_count.description: Number of total jobs available at present

robotapiRobotNodeLockReq.description: Device Lock Request Data. Used Internally by Applications like NCA and PULSE to lock Devices when using them

robotapiRobotNodeOperationalState.description: Derived state for a Device. Cannot be set by user

robotapiRobotNodeReqRc.description: Node Request return code. Used when locking Nodes.

total_count.description: Total number of Tags available at present

robotapiRobotNodeType.description:
- NODE_TYPE_UNKNOWN: Not known
 - NODE_TYPE_ROUTER: Layer 3 router
 - NODE_TYPE_SWITCH: Layer 2 ethernet switch
 - NODE_TYPE_ROADM: Layer 1 optical add/drop Device
 - NODE_TYPE_AMPLIFIER: Layer 1 optical repeater/ amplifier
 - NODE_TYPE_CBR: Converged broadband router

robotapiRobotOnboardingType.description: - FROM_PROVIDER: The Direction to onboard Devices. FROM PROVIDER will onboard Devices from NSO to CW. and Vice Versa for TO PROVIDER

uuid.description:
Internal key, mandatory field. Allocated internally on Provider
creation. UUID is a generated value based on the name

connectivity_info.description: All supported transports allowed to connect to this Provider.

profile.description: Credential Profile applicable to this Provider. Mandatory field.

last_upd_time.description:
Last time this Provider Entry was Updated in DB.
Unix time in seconds.

last_reach_time.description:
Last time this Provider was determined to be reachable.
Unix time in seconds.

properties.description: Map to configure Provider-specific properties as key-value pairs

total_count.description: Total number of Providers available at present

robotapiRobotProviderDeviceKey.description: Key types used for generating UUIDs for Providers

limit.description: Number of Providers requested in the response

sort_by_field.description: The field name in RobotProviderData to use for sorting. If this field is omitted, data is sorted on the Provider name, by default.

last_key.description: Ask for data beyond last_key per the sorted order

filter.description: Filter for the request. The UUID, type, name, lock_state, and reachability_state are supported. Combination of filters is also supported.

robotapiRobotReachCheck.description: Flag to turn the Reachability Check on or off

code.description: Typically from an enum defined by the component.

desc.description: Description of error. May not be filled for success error codes.

ipaddrs.description: V4/V6 IP address for this connectivity type

reachability_state_upd_time.description: Reachability timestamp. The time when the reachability state was last updated, given in Unix epoch time in seconds.

error.description: Error reason for protocol reachability failure

data.description: Common data to be updated across the set of Nodes

robotapiRobotUserPassEnable.description: ROBOT_USERPASSEN_ENABLE: Enables second-level authentication in Devices where this feature is available. For example: Cisco IOS XE Devices. When this option is selected, the password for second-level authentication must be given.

model_prefix.description: Yang model prefix. For example: Cisco-IOS-XR, Cisco-NX-OS, Cisco-IOS-XE.
